aural.html#spatial-props.summary: In combination with elevation, the azimuth CSS property enables different audio sources to be positioned spatially for aural presentation. This is important in that it provides a natural way to tell several voices apart, as each can be positioned to originate at a different location on the sound stage. Stereo output produce a lateral sound stage, while binaural headphones and multi-speaker setups allow for a fully three-dimensional stage.
aural.html#spatial-props.title: azimuth

aural.html#times.summary: The time CSS data type represents a time value expressed in seconds or milliseconds. It is used in animation, transition, and related properties.
aural.html#times.title: <time>

box.html#border-color-properties.summary: The border-color shorthand CSS property sets the color of all sides of an element's border.

firefox.notes: Firefox also supports the following non-standard CSS properties to set the border sides to multiple colors: -moz-border-top-colors, -moz-border-right-colors, -moz-border-bottom-colors, -moz-border-left-colors

firefox_android.notes: Firefox also supports the following non-standard CSS properties to set the border sides to multiple colors: -moz-border-top-colors, -moz-border-right-colors, -moz-border-bottom-colors, -moz-border-left-colors

box.html#border-color-properties.title: border-color

box.html#border-shorthand-properties.summary: The border CSS property sets an element's border. It's a shorthand for border-width, border-style, and border-color.
box.html#border-shorthand-properties.title: border

box.html#border-style-properties.summary: The border-bottom-style CSS property sets the line style of an element's bottom border.

firefox.notes: Prior to Firefox 50, border styles of rounded corners (with border-radius) were always rendered as if border-bottom-style was solid. This has been fixed in Firefox 50.

firefox_android.notes: Prior to Firefox 50, border styles of rounded corners (with border-radius) were always rendered as if border-bottom-style was solid. This has been fixed in Firefox 50.

box.html#border-style-properties.title: border-bottom-style

box.html#border-style-properties.summary: The border-left-style CSS property sets the line style of an element's left border.

firefox.notes: Prior to Firefox 50, border styles of rounded corners (with border-radius) were always rendered as if border-bottom-style was solid. This has been fixed in Firefox 50.

firefox_android.notes: Prior to Firefox 50, border styles of rounded corners (with border-radius) were always rendered as if border-bottom-style was solid. This has been fixed in Firefox 50.

box.html#border-style-properties.title: border-left-style

box.html#border-style-properties.summary: The border-right-style CSS property sets the line style of an element's right border.

firefox.notes: Prior to Firefox 50, border styles of rounded corners (with border-radius) were always rendered as if border-bottom-style was solid. This has been fixed in Firefox 50.

firefox_android.notes: Prior to Firefox 50, border styles of rounded corners (with border-radius) were always rendered as if border-bottom-style was solid. This has been fixed in Firefox 50.

box.html#border-style-properties.title: border-right-style

box.html#border-style-properties.summary: The border-top-style CSS property sets the line style of an element's top border.

firefox.notes: Prior to Firefox 50, border styles of rounded corners (with border-radius) were always rendered as if border-top-style was solid. This has been fixed in Firefox 50.

firefox_android.notes: Prior to Firefox 50, border styles of rounded corners (with border-radius) were always rendered as if border-top-style was solid. This has been fixed in Firefox 50.

box.html#border-style-properties.title: border-top-style

box.html#border-width-properties.summary: The border-bottom-width CSS property sets the width of the bottom border of a box.
box.html#border-width-properties.title: border-bottom-width

box.html#border-width-properties.summary: The border-left-width CSS property sets the width of the left border of an element.
box.html#border-width-properties.title: border-left-width

box.html#border-width-properties.summary: The border-right-width CSS property sets the width of the right border of an element.
box.html#border-width-properties.title: border-right-width

box.html#border-width-properties.summary: The border-top-width CSS property sets the width of the top border of an element.
box.html#border-width-properties.title: border-top-width

box.html#border-width-properties.summary: The border-width shorthand CSS property sets the widths of all four sides of an element's border.
box.html#border-width-properties.title: border-width

box.html#margin-properties.summary: The margin-bottom CSS property sets the margin area on the bottom of an element. A positive value places it farther from its neighbors, while a negative value places it closer.
box.html#margin-properties.title: margin-bottom

box.html#margin-properties.summary: The margin-left CSS property sets the margin area on the left side of an element. A positive value places it farther from its neighbors, while a negative value places it closer.
box.html#margin-properties.title: margin-left

box.html#margin-properties.summary: The margin-right CSS property sets the margin area on the right side of an element. A positive value places it farther from its neighbors, while a negative value places it closer.
box.html#margin-properties.title: margin-right

box.html#margin-properties.summary: The margin-top CSS property sets the margin area on the top of an element. A positive value places it farther from its neighbors, while a negative value places it closer.
box.html#margin-properties.title: margin-top

box.html#margin-properties.summary: The margin CSS property sets the margin area on all four sides of an element. It is a shorthand for margin-top, margin-right, margin-bottom, and margin-left.
box.html#margin-properties.title: margin

box.html#padding-properties.summary: The padding-bottom CSS property sets the height of the padding area on the bottom of an element.
box.html#padding-properties.title: padding-bottom

box.html#padding-properties.summary: The padding-left CSS property sets the width of the padding area on the left side of an element.
box.html#padding-properties.title: padding-left

box.html#padding-properties.summary: The padding-right CSS property sets the width of the padding area on the right side of an element.
box.html#padding-properties.title: padding-right

box.html#padding-properties.summary: The padding-top padding area on the top of an element.
box.html#padding-properties.title: padding-top

box.html#propdef-border-bottom.summary: The border-bottom CSS property is a shorthand that sets the values of border-bottom-width, border-bottom-style and border-bottom-color.
box.html#propdef-border-bottom.title: border-bottom

box.html#propdef-border-bottom-color.summary: The border-bottom-color CSS property sets the color of an element's bottom border. It can also be set with the shorthand CSS properties border-color or border-bottom.

firefox.notes: Firefox also supports the non-standard -moz-border-bottom-colors CSS property that sets the bottom border to multiple colors.

firefox_android.notes: Firefox also supports the non-standard -moz-border-bottom-colors CSS property that sets the bottom border to multiple colors.

box.html#propdef-border-bottom-color.title: border-bottom-color

box.html#propdef-border-left.summary: The border-left CSS property is a shorthand that sets the values of border-left-width, border-left-style and border-left-color.
box.html#propdef-border-left.title: border-left

box.html#propdef-border-left-color.summary: The border-left-color CSS property sets the color of an element's left border. It can also be set with the shorthand CSS properties border-color or border-left.

firefox.notes: Firefox also supports the non-standard -moz-border-left-colors CSS property that sets the bottom border to multiple colors.

firefox_android.notes: Firefox also supports the non-standard -moz-border-left-colors CSS property that sets the bottom border to multiple colors.

box.html#propdef-border-left-color.title: border-left-color

box.html#propdef-border-right.summary: The border-right CSS property is a shorthand that sets the values of border-right-width, border-right-style and border-right-color.
box.html#propdef-border-right.title: border-right

box.html#propdef-border-right-color.summary: The border-right-color CSS property sets the color of an element's right border. It can also be set with the shorthand CSS properties border-color or border-right.

firefox.notes: Firefox also supports the non-standard -moz-border-right-colors CSS property that sets the right border to multiple colors.

firefox_android.notes: Firefox also supports the non-standard -moz-border-right-colors CSS property that sets the right border to multiple colors.

box.html#propdef-border-right-color.title: border-right-color

box.html#propdef-border-top.summary: The border-top CSS property is a shorthand that sets the values of border-top-width, border-top-style and border-top-color.
box.html#propdef-border-top.title: border-top

box.html#propdef-border-top-color.summary: The border-top-color CSS property sets the color of an element's top border. It can also be set with the shorthand CSS properties border-color or border-top.

firefox.notes: Firefox also supports the non-standard -moz-border-top-colors CSS property that sets the top border to multiple colors.

firefox_android.notes: Firefox also supports the non-standard -moz-border-top-colors CSS property that sets the top border to multiple colors.

box.html#propdef-border-top-color.title: border-top-color

box.html#propdef-padding.summary: The padding CSS property sets the padding area on all four sides of an element. It is a shorthand for padding-top, padding-right, padding-bottom, and padding-left.
box.html#propdef-padding.title: padding

cascade.html#at-import.summary: The @import CSS at-rule is used to import style rules from other style sheets. These rules must precede all other types of rules, except @charset rules; as it is not a nested statement, @import cannot be used inside conditional group at-rules.
cascade.html#at-import.title: @import

cascade.html#value-def-inherit.summary: The inherit CSS keyword causes the element for which it is specified to take the computed value of the property from its parent element.
cascade.html#value-def-inherit.title: inherit

colors.html#colors.summary: The color CSS property sets the foreground color value of an element's text and text decorations, and sets the currentcolor value.
colors.html#colors.title: color

colors.html#propdef-background.summary: The background shorthand CSS property sets all background style properties at once, such as color, image, origin and size, or repeat method.
colors.html#propdef-background.title: background

colors.html#propdef-background-attachmen.summary: The background-attachment CSS property sets whether a background image's position is fixed within the viewport, or scrolls with its containing block.
colors.html#propdef-background-attachmen.title: background-attachment

colors.html#propdef-background-color.summary: The background-color CSS property sets the background color of an element.

ie.notes: In Internet Explorer 8 and 9, there is a bug where a computed background-color of transparent causes click events to not get fired on overlaid elements.

colors.html#propdef-background-color.title: background-color

colors.html#propdef-background-image.summary: The background-image CSS property sets one or more background images on an element.

notes: If the browser.display.use_document_colors user preference in about:config is set to false, background images will not be displayed.

colors.html#propdef-background-image.title: background-image

colors.html#propdef-background-position.summary: The background-position CSS property sets the initial position for each background image. The position is relative to the position layer set by background-origin.
colors.html#propdef-background-position.title: background-position

colors.html#propdef-background-position.summary: The position CSS data type denotes a two-dimensional coordinate used to set a location relative to an element box. It is used in the background-position property.
colors.html#propdef-background-position.title: <position>

colors.html#propdef-background-repeat.summary: The background-repeat CSS property sets how background images are repeated. A background image can be repeated along the horizontal and vertical axes, or not repeated at all.
colors.html#propdef-background-repeat.title: background-repeat

fonts.html#font-shorthand.summary: The font CSS property is a shorthand for font-style, font-variant, font-weight, font-size, line-height, and font-family. Alternatively, it sets an element's font to a system font.
fonts.html#font-shorthand.title: font

fonts.html#propdef-font-family.summary: The font-family CSS property specifies a prioritized list of one or more font family names and/or generic family names for the selected element.
fonts.html#propdef-font-family.title: font-family

fonts.html#propdef-font-size.summary: The font-size CSS property sets the size of the font.
fonts.html#propdef-font-size.title: font-size

fonts.html#propdef-font-style.summary: The font-style CSS property sets whether a font should be styled with a normal, italic, or oblique face from its font-family.

firefox.notes: Before Firefox 44, oblique was not distinguished from italic.

firefox_android.notes: Before Firefox 44, oblique was not distinguished from italic.

fonts.html#propdef-font-style.title: font-style

fonts.html#propdef-font-weight.summary: The font-weight CSS property specifies the weight (or boldness) of the font. The font weights available to you will depend on the font-family you are using. Some fonts are only available in normal and bold.
fonts.html#propdef-font-weight.title: font-weight

generate.html#before-after-content.summary: In CSS, ::after creates a pseudo-element that is the last child of the selected element. It is often used to add cosmetic content to an element with the content property.

notes: Before Firefox 57, Firefox had a bug where ::after pseudo-elements were still generated, even if the content property value were set to normal or none.
Before Firefox 3.5, only the CSS level 2 behavior of :after was supported, which disallowed position, float, list-style-* and some display properties.

generate.html#before-after-content.title: ::after (:after)

generate.html#before-after-content.summary: In CSS, ::before creates a pseudo-element that is the first child of the selected element. It is often used to add cosmetic content to an element with the content property.

notes: Before Firefox 57, Firefox had a bug where ::before pseudo-elements were still generated, even if the content property value were set to normal or none.
Before Firefox 3.5, only the CSS level 2 behavior of :before was supported, which disallowed position, float, list-style-* and some display properties.

generate.html#before-after-content.title: ::before (:before)

generate.html#content.summary: The content CSS property replaces an element with a generated value. Objects inserted using the content property are anonymous replaced elements.
generate.html#content.title: content

generate.html#propdef-counter-increment.summary: The counter-increment CSS property increases or decreases the value of a CSS counter by a given value.
generate.html#propdef-counter-increment.title: counter-increment

generate.html#propdef-counter-reset.summary: The counter-reset CSS property resets a CSS counter to a given value.
generate.html#propdef-counter-reset.title: counter-reset

generate.html#propdef-list-style.summary: The list-style CSS property is a shorthand to set list style properties list-style-type, list-style-image, and list-style-position.
generate.html#propdef-list-style.title: list-style

generate.html#propdef-list-style-image.summary: The list-style-image CSS property sets an image to be used as the list item marker.
generate.html#propdef-list-style-image.title: list-style-image

generate.html#propdef-list-style-positio.summary: The list-style-position CSS property sets the position of the ::marker relative to a list item.
generate.html#propdef-list-style-positio.title: list-style-position

generate.html#propdef-list-style-type.summary: The list-style-type CSS property sets the marker (such as a disc, character, or custom counter style) of a list item element.
generate.html#propdef-list-style-type.title: list-style-type

generate.html#quotes.summary: The quotes CSS property sets how quotation marks appear.
generate.html#quotes.title: quotes

generate.html#x18.summary: The attr() CSS function is used to retrieve the value of an attribute of the selected element and use it in the style sheet. It can also be used on pseudo-elements, in which case the value of the attribute on the pseudo-element's originating element is returned.
generate.html#x18.title: attr()

media.html#at-media-rule.summary: The @media CSS at-rule can be used to apply part of a style sheet based on the result of one or more media queries.
media.html#at-media-rule.title: @media

page.html#break-inside.summary: The orphans CSS property sets the minimum number of lines in a block container that must be shown at the bottom of a page, region, or column.
page.html#break-inside.title: orphans

page.html#break-inside.summary: The widows CSS property sets the minimum number of lines in a block container that must be shown at the top of a page, region, or column.
page.html#break-inside.title: widows

page.html#page-selectors.summary: The @page CSS at-rule is used to modify some CSS properties when printing a document. You can't change all CSS properties with @page. You can only change the margins, orphans, widows, and page breaks of the document. Attempts to change any other CSS properties will be ignored.
page.html#page-selectors.title: @page

page.html#page-selectors.summary: The :first CSS pseudo-class, used with the  @page at-rule, represents the first page of a printed document.
page.html#page-selectors.title: :first

page.html#page-selectors.summary: The :left CSS pseudo-class, used with the @page at-rule, represents all left-hand pages of a printed document.
page.html#page-selectors.title: :left

page.html#page-selectors.summary: The :right CSS pseudo-class, used with the @page at-rule, represents all right-hand pages of a printed document.
page.html#page-selectors.title: :right

page.html#propdef-page-break-after.summary: The page-break-after CSS property adjusts page breaks after the current element.

firefox.notes: The values avoid, left, and right are unsupported.

page.html#propdef-page-break-after.title: page-break-after

page.html#propdef-page-break-before.summary: The page-break-before CSS property adjusts page breaks before the current element.

firefox.notes: The values avoid, left, and right are unsupported.

page.html#propdef-page-break-before.title: page-break-before

page.html#propdef-page-break-inside.summary: The page-break-inside CSS property adjusts page breaks inside the current element.

firefox.notes: Until Firefox 25, page-break-inside: avoid did not work with the height of a block.

firefox_android.notes: Until Firefox 25, page-break-inside: avoid did not work with the height of a block.

page.html#propdef-page-break-inside.title: page-break-inside

selector.html#adjacent-selectors.summary: The adjacent sibling combinator (+) separates two selectors and matches the second element only if it immediately follows the first element, and both are children of the same parent element.

notes: Internet Explorer 7 doesn't update the style correctly when an element is dynamically placed before an element that matched the selector.
In Internet Explorer 8, if an element is inserted dynamically by clicking on a link the first-child style isn't applied until the link loses focus.

selector.html#adjacent-selectors.title: Adjacent sibling combinator

selector.html#attribute-selectors.summary: The CSS attribute selector matches elements based on the presence or value of a given attribute.
selector.html#attribute-selectors.title: Attribute selectors

selector.html#child-selectors.summary: The child combinator () is placed between two CSS selectors. It matches only those elements matched by the second selector that are the children of elements matched by the first.
selector.html#child-selectors.title: Child combinator

selector.html#class-html.summary: The CSS class selector matches elements based on the contents of their class attribute.
selector.html#class-html.title: Class selectors

selector.html#descendant-selectors.summary: The descendant combinator — typically represented by a single space ( ) character — combines two selectors such that elements matched by the second selector are selected if they have an ancestor element matching the first selector. Selectors that utilize a descendant combinator are called descendant selectors.

notes: >>> is aliased to this selector since its use as the 'shadow-piercing descendant combinator' was deprecated.
>>> is aliased to this selector since its use as the 'shadow-piercing descendant combinator' was deprecated.

selector.html#descendant-selectors.title: Descendant combinator

selector.html#dynamic-pseudo-classes.summary: The :active CSS pseudo-class represents an element (such as a button) that is being activated by the user.
selector.html#dynamic-pseudo-classes.title: :active

selector.html#dynamic-pseudo-classes.summary: The :focus CSS pseudo-class represents an element (such as a form input) that has received focus. It is generally triggered when the user clicks or taps on an element or selects it with the keyboard's "tab" key.
selector.html#dynamic-pseudo-classes.title: :focus

selector.html#dynamic-pseudo-classes.summary: The :hover CSS pseudo-class matches when the user interacts with an element with a pointing device, but does not necessarily activate it. It is generally triggered when the user hovers over an element with the cursor (mouse pointer).

safari_ios.notes: As of Safari for iOS 7.1.2, tapping a clickable element causes the element to enter the :hover state. The element will remain in the :hover state until a different element has entered the :hover state.

selector.html#dynamic-pseudo-classes.title: :hover

selector.html#first-child.summary: The :first-child CSS pseudo-class represents the first element among a group of sibling elements.

notes: Internet Explorer 7 doesn't update :first-child styles when elements are added dynamically.
In Internet Explorer 8, if an element is inserted dynamically by clicking on a link, then the :first-child style isn't applied until the link loses focus.

selector.html#first-child.title: :first-child

selector.html#first-letter.summary: The ::first-letter CSS pseudo-element applies styles to the first letter of the first line of a block-level element, but only when not preceded by other content (such as images or inline tables).
selector.html#first-letter.title: ::first-letter (:first-letter)

selector.html#first-line-pseudo.summary: The ::first-line CSS pseudo-element applies styles to the first line of a block-level element.

chrome.notes: Before Chrome 62, the text-transform property does not work on ::first-line pseudo-elements. See Chromium bug 129669.
Before Chrome 62, the text-transform property does not work on ::first-line pseudo-elements. See Chromium bug 129669.

opera.notes: From Opera 15 to Opera 49 (exclusive), the text-transform property does not work on ::first-line or :first-line pseudo-elements. See Chromium bug 129669.
From Opera 15 to Opera 49 (exclusive), the text-transform property does not work on ::first-line or :first-line pseudo-elements. See Chromium bug 129669.

safari.notes: The text-transform property does not work for ::first-line or :first-line pseudo-elements. See WebKit bug 3409.
The text-transform property does not work for ::first-line or :first-line pseudo-elements. See WebKit bug 3409.

selector.html#first-line-pseudo.title: ::first-line (:first-line)

selector.html#id-selectors.summary: The CSS ID selector matches an element based on the value of its id attribute. In order for the element to be selected, its ID attribute must match exactly the value given in the selector.
selector.html#id-selectors.title: ID selectors

selector.html#lang.summary: The :lang() CSS pseudo-class matches elements based on the language they are determined to be in.
selector.html#lang.title: :lang()

selector.html#link-pseudo-classes.summary: The :link CSS pseudo-class represents an element that has not yet been visited. It matches every unvisited a, area, or link element that has an href attribute.
selector.html#link-pseudo-classes.title: :link

selector.html#link-pseudo-classes.summary: The :visited CSS pseudo-class represents links that the user has already visited. For privacy reasons, the styles that can be modified using this selector are very limited.
selector.html#link-pseudo-classes.title: :visited

selector.html#type-selectors.summary: The CSS type selector matches elements by node name. In other words, it selects all elements of the given type within a document.
selector.html#type-selectors.title: Type selectors

selector.html#universal-selector.summary: The CSS universal selector (*) matches elements of any type.
selector.html#universal-selector.title: Universal selectors

syndata.html#length-units.summary: The length CSS data type represents a distance value. Lengths can be used in numerous CSS properties, such as width, height, margin, padding, border-width, font-size, and text-shadow.
syndata.html#length-units.title: <length>

syndata.html#length-units.summary: The length CSS data type represents a distance value. Lengths can be used in numerous CSS properties, such as width, height, margin, padding, border-width, font-size, and text-shadow.
syndata.html#length-units.title: <length>

syndata.html#numbers.summary: The integer CSS data type is a special type of number that represents a whole number, whether positive or negative. Integers can be used in numerous CSS properties, such as column-count, counter-increment, grid-column, grid-row, and z-index.
syndata.html#numbers.title: <integer>

syndata.html#numbers.summary: The number CSS data type represents a number, being either an integer or a number with a fractional component.
syndata.html#numbers.title: <number>

syndata.html#percentage-units.summary: The percentage CSS data type represents a percentage value. It is often used to define a size as relative to an element's parent object. Numerous properties can use percentages, such as width, height, margin, padding, and font-size.
syndata.html#percentage-units.title: <percentage>

syndata.html#strings.summary: The string CSS data type represents a sequence of characters. Strings are used in numerous CSS properties, such as content, font-family, and quotes.
syndata.html#strings.title: <string>

syndata.html#uri.summary: The url CSS data type denotes a pointer to a resource, such as an image or a font. URLs can be used in numerous CSS properties, such as background-image, cursor, and list-style.
syndata.html#uri.title: <url>

syndata.html#uri.summary: The url CSS data type denotes a pointer to a resource, such as an image or a font. URLs can be used in numerous CSS properties, such as background-image, cursor, and list-style.
syndata.html#uri.title: <url>

syndata.html#x57.summary: The @charset CSS at-rule specifies the character encoding used in the style sheet. It must be the first element in the style sheet and not be preceded by any character; as it is not a nested statement, it cannot be used inside conditional group at-rules. If several @charset at-rules are defined, only the first one is used, and it cannot be used inside a style attribute on an HTML element or inside the style element where the character set of the HTML page is relevant.

firefox.notes: Firefox 1 supported an invalid syntax where the character encoding is not between single or double quotes.

ie.notes: From Internet Explorer 5.5 to IE 7 (inclusive), Internet Explorer supported an invalid syntax where the character encoding is not between single or double quotes.

syndata.html#x57.title: @charset

tables.html#borders.summary: The border-collapse CSS property sets whether cells inside a table have shared or separate borders.
tables.html#borders.title: border-collapse

tables.html#caption-position.summary: The caption-side CSS property puts the content of a table's caption on the specified side. The values are relative to the writing-mode of the table.
tables.html#caption-position.title: caption-side

tables.html#empty-cells.summary: The empty-cells CSS property sets whether borders and backgrounds appear around table cells that have no visible content.
tables.html#empty-cells.title: empty-cells

tables.html#separated-borders.summary: The border-spacing CSS property sets the distance between the borders of adjacent table cells. This property applies only when border-collapse is separate.
tables.html#separated-borders.title: border-spacing

tables.html#width-layout.summary: The table-layout CSS property sets the algorithm used to lay out table cells, rows, and columns.
tables.html#width-layout.title: table-layout

text.html#alignment-prop.summary: The text-align CSS property sets the horizontal alignment of an inline or table-cell box. This means it works like vertical-align but in the horizontal direction.
text.html#alignment-prop.title: text-align

text.html#caps-prop.summary: The text-transform CSS property specifies how to capitalize an element's text. It can be used to make text appear in all-uppercase or all-lowercase, or with each word capitalized.

chrome.notes: The text-transform property does not work for ::first-line pseudo-elements (nor for the one-colon syntax). See Chromium bug 129669.

opera.notes: Since Opera 15, the text-transform property does not work for ::first-line pseudo-elements (nor for the one-colon syntax). See Chromium bug 129669.

safari.notes: The text-transform property does not work for ::first-line pseudo-elements (also not for the old one-colon syntax). See WebKit bug 3409.

safari_ios.notes: The text-transform property does not work for ::first-line pseudo-elements (also not for the old one-colon syntax). See WebKit bug 3409.

webview_android.notes: The text-transform property does not work for ::first-line pseudo-elements (nor for the one-colon syntax). See Chromium bug 129669.

text.html#caps-prop.title: text-transform

text.html#indentation-prop.summary: The text-indent CSS property sets the length of empty space (indentation) that is put before lines of text in a block.
text.html#indentation-prop.title: text-indent

text.html#lining-striking-props.summary: The text-decoration CSS property sets the appearance of decorative lines on text. It is a shorthand for text-decoration-line, text-decoration-color, and text-decoration-style.
text.html#lining-striking-props.title: text-decoration

text.html#propdef-letter-spacing.summary: The letter-spacing CSS property sets the spacing behavior between text characters.
text.html#propdef-letter-spacing.title: letter-spacing

text.html#propdef-word-spacing.summary: The word-spacing CSS property sets the length of space between words and between tags.
text.html#propdef-word-spacing.title: word-spacing

text.html#white-space-prop.summary: The white-space CSS property sets how white space inside an element is handled.
text.html#white-space-prop.title: white-space

ui.html#cursor-props.summary: The cursor CSS property sets mouse cursor to display when the mouse pointer is over an element.

ie.notes: In Internet Explorer 11, when cursor is applied to an element and this element is underneath an open <select> menu and the user hovers over a <select> menu item that's on top of said element, the cursor for said element will be displayed rather than the <select>'s normal cursor. See bug 817822.

ui.html#cursor-props.title: cursor

ui.html#propdef-outline.summary: The outline CSS property is a shorthand to set various outline properties in a single declaration: outline-style, outline-width, and outline-color.

firefox.notes: Firefox includes absolutely positioned elements inside the outline (see bug 687311).

ui.html#propdef-outline.title: outline

ui.html#propdef-outline-color.summary: The outline-color CSS property sets the color of an element's outline.
ui.html#propdef-outline-color.title: outline-color

ui.html#propdef-outline-style.summary: The outline-style CSS property sets the style of an element's outline. An outline is a line that is drawn around an element, outside the border.
ui.html#propdef-outline-style.title: outline-style

ui.html#propdef-outline-width.summary: The outline-width CSS property sets the thickness of an element's outline. An outline is a line that is drawn around an element, outside the border.
ui.html#propdef-outline-width.title: outline-width

visudet.html#min-max-heights.summary: The max-height CSS property sets the maximum height of an element. It prevents the used value of the height property from becoming larger than the value specified for max-height.

firefox.notes: CSS 2.1 leaves the behavior of max-height with table undefined. Firefox supports applying max-height to table elements.

opera.notes: CSS 2.1 leaves the behavior of max-height with table undefined. Opera supports applying max-height to table elements.

visudet.html#min-max-heights.title: max-height

visudet.html#min-max-heights.summary: The min-height CSS property sets the minimum height of an element. It prevents the used value of the height property from becoming smaller than the value specified for min-height.

firefox.notes: CSS 2.1 leaves the behavior of min-height with table undefined. Firefox supports applying min-height to table elements.

ie.notes: In Internet Explorer 10 and 11, a min-height declaration on a column-direction flex container doesn't apply to the container's flex items. See Flexbug #3 for more info.

opera.notes: CSS 2.1 leaves the behavior of min-height with table undefined. Opera supports applying min-height to table elements.

visudet.html#min-max-heights.title: min-height

visudet.html#min-max-widths.summary: The max-width CSS property sets the maximum width of an element. It prevents the used value of the width property from becoming larger than the value specified by max-width.

firefox.notes: CSS 2.1 leaves the behavior of max-width with table undefined. Firefox supports applying max-width to table elements.

opera.notes: CSS 2.1 leaves the behavior of max-width with table undefined. Opera supports applying max-width to table elements.

visudet.html#min-max-widths.title: max-width

visudet.html#min-max-widths.summary: The min-width CSS property sets the minimum width of an element. It prevents the used value of the width property from becoming smaller than the value specified for min-width.

firefox.notes: CSS 2.1 leaves the behavior of min-width with table undefined. Firefox supports applying min-width to table elements.

opera.notes: CSS 2.1 leaves the behavior of min-width with table undefined. Opera supports applying min-width to table elements.

visudet.html#min-max-widths.title: min-width

visudet.html#propdef-line-height.summary: The line-height CSS property sets the amount of space used for lines, such as in text. On block-level elements, it specifies the minimum height of line boxes within the element. On non-replaced inline elements, it specifies the height that is used to calculate line box height.
visudet.html#propdef-line-height.title: line-height

visudet.html#propdef-vertical-align.summary: The vertical-align CSS property  sets vertical alignment of an inline or table-cell box.
visudet.html#propdef-vertical-align.title: vertical-align

visudet.html#the-height-property.summary: The height CSS property specifies the height of an element. By default, the property defines the height of the content area. If box-sizing is set to border-box, however, it instead determines the height of the border area.
visudet.html#the-height-property.title: height

visudet.html#the-width-property.summary: The width CSS property sets an element's width. By default it sets the width of the content area, but if box-sizing is set to border-box, it sets the width of the border area.
visudet.html#the-width-property.title: width

visufx.html#overflow.summary: The overflow CSS property sets what to do when an element's content is too big to fit in its block formatting context. It is a shorthand for overflow-x and overflow-y.

firefox.notes: After Firefox 3.6, the overflow property is correctly applied to table group elements (<thead>, <tbody>, <tfoot>).

ie.notes: From version 4 to 6, Internet Explorer enlarges an element with overflow: visible (default value) to fit the content inside it. height and width behave like min-height and min-width, respectively.

visufx.html#overflow.title: overflow

visufx.html#visibility.summary: The visibility CSS property shows or hides an element without changing the layout of a document. The property can also hide rows or columns in a table.

notes: Up to Internet Explorer 7, descendants of hidden elements will still be invisible even if they have visibility set to visible.

visufx.html#visibility.title: visibility

visuren.html#choose-position.summary: The bottom CSS property participates in specifying the vertical position of a positioned element. It has no effect on non-positioned elements.

ie.notes: In Internet Explorer versions before 7, when both top and bottom are specified, the element position is overconstrained and the top property has precedence; the computed value of bottom is set to -top, while its specified value is ignored.

visuren.html#choose-position.title: bottom

visuren.html#direction.summary: The direction CSS property sets the direction of text, table columns, and horizontal overflow.
visuren.html#direction.title: direction

visuren.html#display-prop.summary: The display CSS property defines the display type of an element, which consists of the two basic qualities of how an element generates boxes — the outer display type defining how the box participates in flow layout, and the inner display type defining how the children of the box are laid out.
visuren.html#display-prop.title: display

visuren.html#float-position.summary: The float CSS property places an element on the left or right side of its container, allowing text and inline elements to wrap around it.
visuren.html#float-position.title: float

visuren.html#flow-control.summary: The clear CSS property sets whether an element must be moved below (cleared) floating elements that precede it. The clear property applies to floating and non-floating elements.
visuren.html#flow-control.title: clear

visuren.html#propdef-left.summary: The left CSS property participates in specifying the horizontal position of a positioned element. It has no effect on non-positioned elements.
visuren.html#propdef-left.title: left

visuren.html#propdef-position.summary: The position CSS property sets how an element is positioned in a document. The top, right, bottom, and left properties determine the final location of positioned elements.

firefox.notes: Before Firefox 57, absolute positioning did not work correctly when applied to elements inside tables that have border-collapse applied to them (bug 1379306).

ie.notes: In Internet Explorer, fixed positioning doesn't work if the document is in quirks mode.

visuren.html#propdef-position.title: position

visuren.html#propdef-right.summary: The right CSS property participates in specifying the horizontal position of a positioned element. It has no effect on non-positioned elements.
visuren.html#propdef-right.title: right

visuren.html#propdef-top.summary: The top CSS property participates in specifying the vertical position of a positioned element. It has no effect on non-positioned elements.

ie.notes: In Internet Explorer versions before 7, when both top and bottom are specified, the element position is overconstrained and the top property has precedence; the computed value of bottom is set to -top, while its specified value is ignored.

visuren.html#propdef-top.title: top

visuren.html#propdef-unicode-bidi.summary: The unicode-bidi CSS property, together with the direction property, determines how bidirectional text in a document is handled. For example, if a block of content contains both left-to-right and right-to-left text, the user-agent uses a complex Unicode algorithm to decide how to display the text. The unicode-bidi property overrides this algorithm and allows the developer to control the text embedding.
visuren.html#propdef-unicode-bidi.title: unicode-bidi

visuren.html#z-index.summary: The z-index CSS property sets the z-order of a positioned element and its descendants or flex items. Overlapping elements with a larger z-index cover those with a smaller one.
visuren.html#z-index.title: z-index
